paragraph.paragraph:
In both trees of the
00_introduction.xml object tool , objects are displayed. Two categories are made for each objects: its attributes (grouped under the `attributes' folder
16 16 /images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_attribute_symbol.gif ) and its once routines (grouped under the `once routines' folder
16 16 /images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_once_symbol.gif ).
All follow the following symbol scheme to describe the kind of each item:

list.item:
16 16 /images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_immediate_value.gif An attribute of a basic type, such as
INTEGER /libraries/base/reference/kernel/integer_chart.xml ,
DOUBLE /libraries/base/reference/kernel/classic/double_chart.xml ,...
16 16 /images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_object_symbol.gif An attribute that is a reference to an object

paragraph.paragraph: For .NET system, special symbols are used to describe :

list.item: 16 16 /images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_external_symbol.png An object that is external (i.e not known as an Eiffel type)
16 16 /images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_static_external_symbol.png A static value object that is external (i.e not known as an Eiffel type)
16 16 /images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_static_object_symbol.png A static value object that is known as an Eiffel type
